comments.body: We should keep the name of the launch config the same - to say which module its for. It would be difficult to select a particular one if they all say `main.dart`.

This is consistent with the template:
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/tree/master/packages/flutter_tools/templates/create/.idea/runConfigurations

Is the template incorrect?
I think the template is good. For the flutter repo, we have several modules in one project, and it will look odd if all the launch configurations are named `main.dart`.

You mean if you open Idea on `/<flutter root dir>/`? Doesn't that use the runConfig info from https://github.com/flutter/flutter/tree/master/.idea/runConfigurations?

I tested this by opening idea inside each of the examples, e.g.:
```
cd /examples/hello_world/
idea .
```

What folder are you opening?
Ah, you are right. These are just used for when this module is opened individually. `main.dart` sgtm, sorry for the noise.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +0,4 @@<component name="ProjectRunConfigurationManager">
  <configuration default="false" name="main.dart" type="FlutterRunConfigurationType" factoryName="Flutter">
    <option name="filePath" value="$PROJECT_DIR$/lib/main.dart" />
    <method />
